data.text: Thanks for the conversation, Todd Bishop. Coming back to lead Amazon Web Services (AWS) was an incredible opportunity. I’m so proud of the team, all the capabilities we developed for customers, and the business milestones achieved. AWS is better positioned than anyone to expand possibilities for customers going forward. Leaving things in good hands with Matt Garman and the team. https://lnkd.in/gTN4SyDr

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

article.title: Adam Selipsky, the exit interview: Amazon Web Services CEO on AI, competition, and the future
article.subtitle: geekwire.com

data.text: After almost 15 combined years at AWS, I am going to be moving on. It has been a true privilege to help lead this business from pre-revenue to $100B annualized revenue. I’m humbled by the many customers who have said they wouldn’t be what they are without AWS, thankful to our many partners, and grateful to my passionate and innovative teammates. AWS will be in great hands with Matt and the incredible leadership team. I’m looking forward to taking some time off with family, while taking the opportunity to think about my next adventure!

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

data.text:
Great to see Amazon Web Services (AWS) recognized as a Leader in the 2024 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Global Industrial IoT Platforms. 

This designation highlights our relentless focus on empowering industrial customers with the most reliable, secure, and scalable cloud solutions. We understand the unique challenges industrial organizations face in optimizing operations, reducing downtime, and driving efficiency. That's why we've built a powerful portfolio of purpose-built services, a global network of specialized partners, and a scalable edge-to-cloud infrastructure tailored to the industrial sector. https://lnkd.in/g88Pqv8q

data.text: Our thoughts are with everyone in Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil impacted by the devastating flooding. We’ve activated our AWS Disaster Response team in the region. They’re working with Help.NGO to capture high-resolution aerial images of flooded areas in order to support rescue operations. We’re also helping monitor equipment and personnel to keep first responders safe and coordinated. https://lnkd.in/gp6U9XhN

data.text:
Today marks a significant milestone for the telecom industry.

Telefónica Germany announced it will build a new 5G Cloud Core on Amazon Web Services (AWS), done in collaboration with Nokia. This is the first major telecom operator with an existing network to announce it will run its 5G core in the cloud.

Telefónica Germany can now take advantage of full automation and elasticity at scale—all with full data encryption, and the most flexible, reliable, and secure cloud computing environment.

Plus, they can more easily deploy updates to improve customer experience, helping deliver on their vision of building the network of the future. https://lnkd.in/gJ6Y_wTQ

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

article.title: Exclusive: Amazon breaks into Europe 5G networks with Telefonica cloud deal

data.text:
Our goal has always been to make transformative tech like GenAI accessible and easy to use for developers. Today, we’re announcing a new capability in Amazon Bedrock to do just that. https://lnkd.in/gQpefcfe

We're introducing Amazon Bedrock Studio (available in preview), a web-based experience designed to accelerate the development of GenAI applications by providing a rapid prototyping environment with Bedrock features, including Knowledge Bases, Agents, and Guardrails. With Amazon Bedrock Studio, developers can:

⚪ Easily interact with a wide range of LLMs and foundation models
⚪ Collaborate on projects with cross-functional teams
⚪ Leverage a user-friendly interface with playground mode for iterative development
⚪ Seamlessly integrate proprietary data sources, systems, and APIs
⚪ Benefit from centralized access management, policy enforcement, and responsible AI capabilities

author.headline: VP, AWS Agentic AI

data.text:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is investing an additional $9 billion (SG$12B) into our cloud computing infrastructure in Singapore. 

Our investments are expected to support over 12K jobs a year, and contribute $17.6 billion (SG$23.7B) to Singapore’s GDP by 2028. We also announced a new flagship AI program in collaboration with the Singapore Government and government agencies to help enterprises, startups, and communities accelerate their adoption of AI & generative AI. 

The program will support AI research and development, and includes a series of AI and professional certification programs to train 5,000 people a year on AI skills over the next three years. https://lnkd.in/gyrf_BPj

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

data.text:
Excited to see Forbes highlight the first cohort of startups in our new Compute for Climate Fellowship. https://lnkd.in/gEyFehgU

This program provides funding and cloud resources to help founders who are using high performance computing and generative AI to address climate change. We are proud to support innovators like Realta Fusion, a pioneering startup developing compact fusion energy systems to decarbonize industrial heat and power. 

With Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud credits and access to interconnected CPUs/GPUs, Realta can run crucial simulations at unprecedented speed—work that would require supercomputing resources that are typically limited and have long waitlists.

data.text:
🚀 Today, we are thrilled to share that Amazon Q is now generally available.

◼ Amazon Q is the most capable generative AI-powered assistant for accelerating software development and leveraging companies’ internal data. It eliminates tedious work for developers and employees across organizations.

◼ Q helps to test, debug and write code, and has the highest reported code acceptance rates in the industry, for assistants that perform multi-line code suggestions. BT Group recently reported they accepted 37% of Q’s code suggestions and National Australia Bank reported a 50% acceptance rate.

◼ Amazon Q Developer Agents can autonomously perform a range of tasks—everything from implementing features, documenting, and refactoring code, to performing software upgrades. Developers can ask Amazon Q to implement an application feature, and the agent will analyze their existing application code and generate a step-by-step implementation plan.

◼ Amazon Q's capabilities extend beyond coding. It also allows employees to easily get insight from their company's internal data that is spread across multiple documents, systems, and applications. Q connects all these siloed sources and can answer questions, provide summaries, analyze trends, and generate content.

◼ We're also introducing Q Apps, a powerful new way for anyone to create generative AI apps based on their organization's data—no prior coding experience required. Simply describe the app you need in natural language, and Q Apps will build it for you. This unlocks endless possibilities for teams to automate workflows and daily tasks.

Customers across industries are using Amazon Q to transform the way they work. I'm incredibly excited to see what Q can do for you. https://lnkd.in/gd2cBVCi

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to serve as an inaugural member of the Department of Homeland Security’s new Artificial Intelligence Safety and Security Board, announced today. 

As one of the world’s leading developers and deployers of AI tools and services, we support fostering the safe, secure, and responsible development of AI technology. 

We are committed to continued collaboration with policymakers, industry, researchers, critical infrastructure providers, and the AI community to advance the responsible and secure use of AI.
https://lnkd.in/gnwnM78D

Our investment will also deliver workforce training programs and a new AWS InCommunities Fund aimed at supporting initiatives in tech education, sustainability, economic development, and more. 

Investing in the communities where we operate is a top priority, and we are thrilled to partner with state and local leaders in Indiana for many years to come. https://lnkd.in/gbRS9xit

data.text:
Every year, the National Football League (NFL) has the task of sorting through over 1,000,000,000,000,000 (yes, one quadrillion!) schedule possibilities for the upcoming season. 

Before being #PoweredByAWS, the NFL used a manual, white-boarding process which produced only a few potential schedule options per season. Now they’re able to run over one thousand schedule variations a day. And by using Amazon EC2 Spot Instances, the NFL saves $2 million each season. 

My ideal Week 1 schedule has the Seattle Seahawks starting the season off strong and winning against the San Francisco 49ers. Check out ScheduleShowdown.com to create your ideal week 1 matchups.

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

data.text:
Today, we're announcing major new updates for Amazon Bedrock that give customers unparalleled flexibility, choice, and security when developing advanced generative AI apps. 

One I’m especially excited about is the Custom Model Import capability, which allows customers to bring their own models to Amazon Bedrock's secure, managed environment. This promises to unlock new possibilities across industries, as customers can seamlessly access their custom model, like any other on Bedrock, and get all the same powerful capabilities—without having to manage the underlying infrastructure themselves. 

A couple other new updates to share:

🔵 Our model evaluation capability is now generally available, making it simple to analyze, compare, and select the best foundation model for your use case. 
🔵 Also available today, Guardrails for Amazon Bedrock—which offers industry-leading safety protection, helping customers block harmful content, profanity, personal information and more, out-performing all other services available today. 
🔵 Finally, Amazon Bedrock already offers the widest choice of fully managed FMs, and is expanding even further with Amazon Titan Text Embeddings V2, the GA of Titan Image Generator, and new models from Meta with Cohere’s latest models coming soon.
 
Tens of thousands of customers are innovating quickly with Amazon Bedrock. Two such examples: United Airlines modernized its Passenger Service System, making customer support more efficient. The NYSE is using Bedrock across several use cases, including the processing of thousands of pages of regulations to provide answers in easy-to-understand language. 

We know there will be many more success stories like these as we continue to expand Amazon Bedrock, and make it the easiest and fastest way to build and scale secure GenAI applications.
https://lnkd.in/gCkub574

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

data.text:
When you open that next order from Amazon, check out the packaging. An AI model powered by the AWS cloud likely played a key role in picking the most efficient packaging option for your purchase. 

Behind the scenes at our operations sites, our Package Decision Engine uses natural language processing and text-based data from each item Amazon sells, along with computer vision pictures that provide product dimensions. 

All that info helps the model predict the more sustainable packaging to use while still protecting the items. As we expand this innovation globally, the Package Decision Engine will help Amazon avoid excess packaging in more places than ever before. https://lnkd.in/gtKVvEpc

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

data.text:
Just wrapping an incredible trip to France and the UK where I spent invaluable time with enterprise customers, startups, and our amazing employees, who are getting ready for what promises to be a great London Summit next week. 

With generative AI, companies are unleashing innovation in ways unheard of before, and more and more customers are trusting Amazon Web Services (AWS) to power their AI journey. That’s a responsibility we don’t take lightly. 

Great British brands like BT Group and The Very Group are making huge productivity and customer service innovations & improvements using Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker. 

In France, with its rich engineering heritage, you can feel the buzz of excitement that generative AI is creating, from amazing French startups pioneering LLM innovation like Hugging Face and Mistral AI, to French unicorns like Owkin using our AWS solutions to help drive changes in disease detection and treatment. 

That buzz is infectious, France’s biggest companies like AXA are paving the way in how they use GenAI to transform their businesses. And anyone going to Paris for this year’s Olympics should look at the generative AI-powered customized travel experiences AWS customers like Accor and Lonely Planet can deliver. 

Seeing our team’s passion for AI and hearing from customers and partners about the material difference AWS is making to their businesses is all the reason I need to come back.

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

data.text:
Security has been our highest priority at AWS since Day 1. Our customers count on us to deliver this every day, and they can count on this same protection for their workloads in the era of generative AI. 

Foundation models and the applications built around them use highly sensitive business information, so protecting this data is critical. We've innovated across our entire generative AI stack to build in security from the ground up. 

Our AWS Nitro System physically isolates and encrypts customer workloads and data. And soon, you’ll be able to encrypt your sensitive AI data using cryptographic keys that you own and control, store that data in a location of your choice, and securely transfer the encrypted data to an isolated compute environment for inferencing. 

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re continuing to invest in building the best capabilities so our customers can innovate with generative AI securely. https://lnkd.in/gbvFzUhE

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

data.text:
Claude 3 Opus, the powerhouse AI model from Anthropic, is now available on Amazon Bedrock. 

Opus can tackle highly complex tasks with remarkable fluency, and has the ability to navigate open-ended scenarios with human-like understanding. Bedrock is the easiest and most secure place to get started with gen AI, and now provides even more options for customers who need the ability to choose the right model for their use case. 

Claude 3 Opus early benchmarks show it outperforming peers, including GPT-4, on expert knowledge, reasoning, and math tasks. Check out the new model in action in the Bedrock console, and let us know what you think. https://lnkd.in/gNhDCc27

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

data.text:
Esports data company HUDstats serves as a great example of what we are hearing routinely from companies as they accelerate work with generative AI.

Customers want flexibility, and the ability to customize models based on their needs. With Amazon Bedrock, HUDstats can access multiple AI models through a single API, giving them the ability to experiment and tailor solutions just the way they want. 

As CTO, Hristo Yankov put it: “Switching to Amazon Bedrock changed the game for us.” We are happy to help fuel HUDstats’ creative storytelling in esports! #AWS
https://lnkd.in/gNKiH7nP

Amazon Web Services (AWS) and global insurance leader AXA are joining forces to develop the first global B2B risk management and prevention platform to help customers navigate complex risks like natural disasters and cyber threats. 

The platform will use Amazon Bedrock, our fully managed AI service, to provide customers real-time data & analytics and historical data to identify and assess risks that could impact a company’s operations, security, or reputation. 

AXA will make services available on AWS Marketplace & Data Exchange, benefiting our global customers.

Mistral AI’s latest and most advanced text generation model, Mistral Large, is now publicly available on Amazon Bedrock, providing easy access to the industry’s widest choice of high-performing, fully managed foundation models. 

Mistral AI will also use our custom #AWS silicon, Trainium and Inferentia, to build and deploy future foundation models. AWS chips offer unbeatable performance, scalability, and security. https://lnkd.in/g4bW2XPw

data.text:
Our customer, BrainBox AI, just launched a first-of-its-kind generative AI-powered virtual building assistant built on Amazon Bedrock. 

The assistant can carry out tasks like adjusting building temperature, identifying failing equipment, and more—all to improve energy efficiency and lower carbon emissions for commercial buildings. 

The cofounder and CTO of this fast-growing startup says one of the biggest benefits of Bedrock is the ability to switch between leading foundation models at any time, even in the middle of a project. 

Really great to hear feedback like this from customers. Read more about the innovative technology from Brainbox AI. https://lnkd.in/gitn6M2u

CIO Brian Woodring says one of the most valuable aspects of Bedrock is that it establishes a standard platform which helps the mortgage lender get its data “very quickly” to the right AI model. 

A cloud data strategy is key to generative AI success. https://lnkd.in/gyMrb9_E

The Carolina Hurricanes vs. Washington Capitals game was produced remotely using AWS technology, with crews in different locations. The National Hockey League (NHL), NHL Network, and Amazon Web Services (AWS) have been working together testing and iterating on cloud-based production for live broadcasts which will unlock new content creation opportunities for the NHL’s growing global fan base, in addition to reducing production costs. https://lnkd.in/g_P-Fw5a

They accelerated their foundation model training up to 40% using Amazon SageMaker HyperPod. And by deploying models on our best-in-class infrastructure, they’re able to handle over 100k queries per hour without compromising latency or the user experience. 

Proud to support innovators like Perplexity in pushing the boundaries of AI. Happy searching! https://lnkd.in/gJEr5_Wf

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

data.text:
We’re building on our deep history of co-innovation with NVIDIA as we continue making AWS the best place to run NVIDIA GPUs in the cloud. 

Not only will we offer NVIDIA’s new Grace Blackwell GPU platform running seamlessly on Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re integrating it with our industry-leading networking, virtualization, and security capabilities—making it possible for customers to build and run multi-trillion parameter large language models faster, at massive scale, and more securely than anywhere else. 

NVIDIA and AWS engineers are also joining forces to co-develop an AI supercomputer built exclusively on AWS for NVIDIA’s own AI R&D. It will feature 20K+ GB200 Superchips capable of processing a massive 414 exaflops. 

With NVIDIA, we continue to help customers advance generative AI innovation. #GTC24. https://lnkd.in/gAnRauu5

Anthropic’s new Claude 3 Haiku model is now available on Amazon Bedrock! 

Haiku is designed to be the fastest and most cost-effective model on the market for its intelligence category, answering queries with lightning fast speed. Haiku also has image-to-text vision capabilities like other new Claude 3 models, meaning they can analyze images, documents, charts and other data formats. 

Bedrock is the easiest place for customers to access and build with Anthropic’s industry-leading, new models. 

Have fun with Haiku!

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

data.text:
Happy International Women’s Day (IWD)! 

As one of the leaders of the volunteer-led affinity group, Women at AWS, I am honored to have organized today’s celebration at AWS. This year's IWD theme, “Inspire Inclusion,” aligns perfectly with the Women at AWS mission to strive to make AWS Earth’s best workplace and preferred employer for women.

The celebration kicked off with a welcome note from our CEO, Adam Selipsky, followed by an incredible panel discussion about the importance of gender diversity in tech and inclusive practices to support women. Moderated by Dilip Kumar, our community heard from AWS leaders Becky Weiss, Tanuja Randery, Nandini Ramani, and Kara Hartnett Hurst. We are grateful for the support of our CEO and leaders who contributed to the celebration.

Along with our leaders, the celebration provided a platform for over 20 incredible women builders that had unprecedented impact on our customers. Events like these, remind me how fortunate I am to work at a company that values diversity and inclusion. I am grateful to the Women at AWS leadership and community for continuing this important conversation.

When we inspire inclusion, we raise the bar for everyone.

Here is a picture with Adam and the most amazing volunteers, Livleen Kaur and Prerna Nayyar who made the Women at AWS International Women’s Day celebration a huge success!!

#InspireInclusion #IWD2024 #womenataws

author.headline: Corporate Business Development

data.text:
We just announced the launch of the #AWS Generative AI Competency. 

It’s a program to help customers quickly adopt generative AI with our partners that have been technically validated by our AWS Partner Organization. 

Leveraging technologies such as Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Q, and Amazon SageMaker JumpStart, these partners have deep expertise building and deploying groundbreaking applications across industries. 

Our AWS Competency Partners will make it easier than ever for customers to innovate with enterprise-grade security and privacy, choice of foundation models, generative AI applications, and a high-performance, low-cost infrastructure. https://lnkd.in/gsGcz6UC

data.text:
📣 Available today on Amazon Bedrock: Anthropic's new, high-performing Claude 3 foundation model, Sonnet! 

And even more exciting, two more advanced Claude 3 models will be available on Bedrock soon. We’re building on our deep collaboration with Anthropic through these additions, and we know customers will love the next-gen models which demonstrate impressively advanced intelligence. 

In fact, Claude 3 Opus has set a new standard—outperforming other models available today—and all three models bring advanced multimodal understanding, so customers can process and analyze images as inputs to unlock entirely new use cases. 

Amazon Bedrock is the best and easiest place to build and deploy generative AI apps and access leading foundation models like those from Anthropic. 

Customers tell us they appreciate the security, customization options, and cost performance of Bedrock, allowing them to move faster and offer customers better experiences.
https://lnkd.in/gtBwR_jT

data.text:
Announcing powerful new options for customers innovating with generative AI. We're adding models from Mistral AI to Amazon Bedrock. 

These models are impressively fast and customizable for enterprise needs. They have an exceptional understanding of natural language and code-related tasks, making them especially useful for projects that need to switch between both. 

We continue to deliver choice for customers to pick the exact model they need to build applications privately, securely, and responsibly. 

Amazon Bedrock makes it easy to access LLMs and other FMs from leading AI companies including AI21 Labs, Anthropic, Cohere, Meta, Stability AI, and Amazon, and the models from Mistral AI provide even more flexibility for our customers. https://lnkd.in/gPVSwT72

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

article.title: Amazon Bedrock adds Mistral AI models, giving customers more choice
article.subtitle: aboutamazon.com

data.text:
We’re excited about a major milestone for customer BT Group, one of the world’s leading communications services companies. 

Across their business, they are now deploying Amazon CodeWhisperer, which writes code in the integrated development environment with Amazon Q, our generative AI assistant for developers. 

Over the last few months, their developers have seen strong code suggestion acceptance rates of 37%, resulting in over 100K lines of code developers didn't have to write by hand. 

This has accelerated their development organization and allows them to focus more on strategic projects. This is the first in a suite of generative AI tools that BT Group plans to introduce as part of a modernization plan. 

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to collaborate with forward-thinking companies like BT Group to drive efficiency through responsible use of generative AI. https://lnkd.in/d_2uzcWJ

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

article.title: BT boosts developer productivity with Amazon’s generative AI coding assistant
article.subtitle: telecomstechnews.com

data.text:
Customers around the world are coming to Amazon Web Services (AWS) to realize the benefits of generative AI. 

Parsyl is an insurance company that assesses supply chain risks and creates tailored policies to better manage those risks. Parsyl uses Amazon Bedrock to take unwieldy information they get from many different sources and turn it into usable data. 

This removes tedious admin work and allows them to focus on what’s important: quickly identifying patterns of risk for businesses, whether it’s a shipping lane prone to delays, or a door on a truck full of fresh fish left open for too long. 

Parsyl’s use of Amazon Bedrock helps customers get more personalized insurance policies that incentivize better risk management, and ultimately helps reduce waste across the supply chain.

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

resharedPost.text:
New short course on “Serverless LLM apps with Amazon Bedrock” taught by AWS' Mike Chambers! A serverless architecture enables you to quickly deploy your applications without needing to set up and manage compute servers to run your applications on, the maintenance of which can be another full-time job. In this course, you’ll learn how to do this by using an event-driven architecture to build complex AI workflows.

Mike illustrate these concepts by building a cool application that automatically detects incoming customer inquiries, transcribes them with ASR (automatic speech recognition), summarizes them with an LLM using Amazon Bedrock, and deploys serverless with AWS Lambda.

I hope this course makes it much easier for you to build and deploy LLM applications requiring multi-step AI workflows.  Please sign up here: https://lnkd.in/gtxAgQ6H

author.headline: Founder of DeepLearning.AI; Managing General Partner of AI Fund; Exec Chairman of Landing AI

data.text: Check out our latest free course in collaboration with DeepLearning.AI! It’s an immersive tutorial on leveraging tools like Amazon Bedrock to develop serverless LLM applications, making it faster for developers to build and deploy apps.

data.text:
AWS offers the most energy efficient path for our customers to build, train, and run their generative AI applications. 

One of the most visible ways we are innovating to improve energy efficiency is with our Trainium and Inferentia chips. These chips are just one example of how our teams are working across the company to build a more sustainable business for our customers and the planet. Kara Hartnett Hurst gives a view of this innovation in action. https://lnkd.in/dXASKjSC

data.text:
Great work by the team for this recognition as a Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Cloud Database Management Systems, which shows #AWS’s ability to provide a comprehensive set of services for your data foundation across all workloads, use cases, and data types. 

Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers a broad set of database engines so you can choose the right tool for the job. Our breadth of choice and price-performance enable you to address your demanding data challenges—fully managed, secure, and highly available in the cloud. 

Millions of customers choose AWS to solve some of the most complex data problems in the world. Read about our commitment to operational excellence and innovation. https://lnkd.in/gpBqwZ4v

author.headline: Former CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Former President and CEO at Tableau.

data.text:
Amazon is joining the U.S. Artificial Intelligence Safety Institute Consortium to advance safe and secure AI. 

We believe ongoing cooperation between government and industry will be key in addressing the unique challenges posed by evolving technologies like generative AI. 

Amazon will contribute compute credits to help develop tools to evaluate AI safety and help the institute set an interoperable and trusted foundation for responsible AI development and use. 

We look forward to partnering with the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) and others to improve AI safety and security for our customers and communities.
https://lnkd.in/gzJzkTJW

data.text:
The National Football League (NFL) is teaming up with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to take player health and safety to the next level. 

Using AI and machine learning, they are creating a precise picture of each player in training, practice, and games. Teams will get a better idea of what their players need to stay healthy, recover quickly, and optimize performance. 

Very cool to see this technology in action, especially with the Super Bowl coming up on Sunday! 🏈 Jennifer Langton, MBA
https://lnkd.in/gbV57G5t

data.text:
I find that people are usually curious about the Amazon Leadership Principles and how we use them as an operating system to shape company culture and decision making.

Over the weekend, I had the opportunity to attend the annual Harvard Business School Tech Conference, and share some thoughts with students and fellow alumnus, Bharat Anand.

We talked about how Amazon’s culture shapes everything we do, from security leadership, to operational excellence, to innovation in #generativeAI.

Leadership Principles such as Customer Obsession, Invent and Simplify, and Insist on the Highest Standards guide how we act across the company. Thank you to HBS for having me at this year’s conference, and for the great conversation.
